name: Wyndham Philadelphia - Mount Laurel

reviews.title: Not so bad
reviews.text: I was horrified by the reviews I read prior to my stay, but decided to take a chance anyway. The hotel is currently going under renovations and is under new management, so it's moving in the right direction. Staff was very nice. Elevators are slllooooowwwwww..

reviews.title: Fine for one night
reviews.text: The rooms are huge, which really does make a difference if you're staying a few nights. It's right off of the NJ Turnpike as well. Given the price, a pretty fair value and I'll probably stay there again.

reviews.title: not so bad after all
reviews.text: It was as I expected .. Eh! I was only staying for one night (on my way back from Philadelphia) and priceline "forced" it on me (due to its unworthy "3 star" rating), but for an incredibly low price. The room was better than I expected, but the elevators and staff were just about the way other reviewers have said they were - although not THAT bad - just a little on the young side and inexperienced. But if you, too, were recently "forced" into this place by priceline, please do not worry ... it's absolutely fine.

reviews.title: Nice lobby-but the rest......
reviews.text: After reading all of the awful reviews I was leery of staying here, even thouguh I got a great rate $59 plus tax on Hotwire.
I really wanted to like this hotel, but they made it too difficult to do so...
reviews.title: Inconsistent stay

reviews.text: The good: Staff were pleasant and courteous throughout. The room had a nice work area, my Wyndham welcome amenity was waiting in my room and the the room was nicely furnished.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: There were bound to be some problems as evidenced by the notices posted in the lobby/elevator about the ongoing renovation. As other posters have noted, the elevators can be somewhat frustrating. Even accounting for renovation issues, however, I was still disappointed in the stay.
reviews.title: Good value for a few nights

reviews.text: Problems: While the room itself appeared to have been recently re-done, the bathroom still was old with grimy tiles and a mildew ring around the tiles near the top of the tub. There was a set up for coffee service, but no cups. We found items in the drawers from previous occupants of the room. I asked housekeeping to bring clean coffee cups and drinking glasses to the room, but that never happened. The bathroom was stocked...shampoo, check; lotion, check; shower cap, check; shoe buffer, check; soap? soap? There was no soap in the room.
reviews.title: great, but currently renovating

likes.disliked: — bathroom needed renovations and elevator- alll currently being renovated

reviews.text: There are a lot of things that a positive attitude can overcome, and the staff certainly had that, but there is still a long way to go before this property will be up to Wyndham standards.
reviews.title: Only if absolutely necessary

reviews.text: This was an "okay" place. Not cheap, not great, just okay.
reviews.title: Not Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom floor was dirty. The shower smelled like urine, as well as the carpet in the room itself. There was a slight hint of cigarette smoke in the room, but it could have been a smoking room. There was also a deal with lost property of mine, and it not being found.
reviews.title: Horrible
Shabby and shady dealings
reviews.text: Horrendous experience that wil end up costing triple for my personal items that weren't returned.

reviews.title: My family were very happy with the room and services.
reviews.text: Recently stayed here for 2 nights. Furnishings were shabby, rooms were noisy and 1 or two elevators were broken the entire stay. Breakfasts were good but overall impression of hotel was poor. Staff were courteous but not well-trained. Pool is inside and non-apealing.
It was the end of the spring, our family had a pleasant weekend getaway in this hotel.
reviews.title: very pleased
Great breakfast But.......................
reviews.text: I just returned from my stay at this hotel. The breakfast was fantastic, my compliments to the chef. The hotel does not do the Wyndham name any justice. The closet was filthy, the bathroom looked like it had not been cleaned in ages, and the elevator and lobby were wet, because of the pool. One of my girlfriends almost fell. When I asked for an extra towel I waited almost 30 mins. then I had to go to the desk to get it myself.

description: The Wyndham Philadelphia-Mount is located in the heart of the Mount Laurel business district, 20 minutes from downtown Philadelphia and 30 minutes from the Philadelphia International Airport. Amenities include restaurant/bar, indoor pool, fitness center & complimentary parking and Wi-Fi. The Hotel has achieved a 3 Green Key rating through the Green Key Eco-Rating Program. This rating demonstrates that the Hotel has taken significant steps to protect the environment.
